newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ Capital Goods Index falls 0.2 pct in June qtr.
newsitem.headline: NZ Capital Goods Index falls 0.2 pct in June qtr.

text.p: The Capital Goods Price Index fell 0.2 percent in the June 1996 quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Friday.
This follows an increase of 1.0 percent in the December 1995 quarter and no change in the March 1996 quarter.
The index rose 1.2 percent in the year to the June quarter.
SNZ said the most significant decrease in the quarter was the plant, machinery and equipment price index, which fell 0.4 percent.
Other decreases were recorded in the transport equipment price index and the non-residential buildings price index.

The quarterly price movements in the June quarter for each of the six groups were: residential buildings, up 1.9 percent; other construction, up 0.7 percent; land improvements, up 0.6 percent; plant, machinery and equipment, down 0.4 percent; transport equipment, down 0.2 percent; and non-residential buildings, down 0.2 percent.
